name: BMI Gaming
tag_list: digital-out-of-home-entertainment, exer-fitness, exerfitness, videmption, edutainment, arcades, arcade-games, arcade-machines, video-games, video-arcade-games, motion-simulators, motion-rides, amusement-rides, motion-theaters, 3d-theaters, redemption-game
overview:
BMI Gaming (BMIGaming.com) is a global arcade game, amusement device, vending machine and digital “out-of-home” entertainment multichannel distributor founded in 2002 by David L. Young, a serial entrepreneur, marketing professional and arcade games collector, and operated by BMI Worldwide, Inc. based in Boca Raton, FL, with plans to open offices in the Middle East, South American, Europe and Asia in 2011.

BMIGaming.com specializes in Family Entertainment Center (FEC), Location Based Entertainment (LBE) and arcade development consulting, design and floor planning, and sells a broad variety of entertainment products from ticket redemption games, prize merchandisers, coin pushers, claw crane machines to motion simulator rides, 3D/4D motion theaters, video arcade games, pinball machines, jukeboxes, photobooths and kiddie rides, sports games such as air hockey, foosball, darts, shuffleboards and pool tables, plus a variety of vending machine products, bulk vending machines, coin, bill and token change machines and card swipe systems.

BMIGaming.com markets to domestic and international clients, with a export department shipping products to over 90 countries worldwide. The company states that over 95% of its total sales are conducted through its online website. Their customer base ranges from home users, business professionals and high-profile media celebrities to commercial clients such as Family Entertainment Centers, arcades, bars, nightclubs, restaurants, casinos, hotels, resorts, cruise ships, shopping malls and chain stores, as well as educational facilities and non-profit organizations, along with local, state and federal government agencies, including the US Military.

BMIGaming.com has attained several prominent business awards in the few years since its inception, including Inc. Magazine’s “Inc. 500 List” of the fastest growing private firms in America in 2007, PriceWaterhouseCoopers “Hot 100 List” of the fastest growing companies in the US in 2006, and is ranked by Internet Retailer Magazine as one of the “Top 500 Internet Retailers” in the world.

BMIGaming.com lays claim to the “World’s Largest Gaming Superstore” on the internet by sales and by number of products offered, and is ranked as the most visited commercial website (based on total global visitors) for coin-operated machines in the world, according to statistics published by Quantcast.com. The company also hosts one of the largest and most popular video channels on YouTube for arcade games, with over 300 HD-quality videos now online. In early 2009, the rights to BMI Gaming and its domain name were acquired by BMI Worldwide, Inc., which now operates the website under the “BMIGaming.com” brand name.

milestones.description: BMIGaming.com YouTube channel hits over 1,000,000 views in less than 16 months.
milestones.source_description: BMIGaming YT Channel Hits 1MM View Milestone
